channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft -- Windows 10 Servers
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft -- Windows 10 Servers

item.title: CVE-2018-8121|2024-08-05T06:46:13.297Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists when the Windows kernel improperly initializes objects in memory, aka "Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-8207.

item.title: CVE-2018-8140|2024-08-05T06:46:13.496Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An Elevation of Privilege vulnerability exists when Cortana retrieves data from user input services without consideration for status, aka "Cortana Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10.

item.title: CVE-2018-8454|2024-08-05T06:54:36.536Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists when Windows Audio Service fails to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Windows Audio Service Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10, Windows Server 2019.

item.title: CVE-2018-8350|2024-08-05T06:54:36.058Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Microsoft Windows PDF Library improperly handles objects in memory, aka "Windows PDF Remote Code Execution Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10.

item.title: CVE-2018-8414|2024-08-05T06:54:36.389Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when the Windows Shell does not properly validate file paths, aka "Windows Shell Remote Code Execution Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10.

item.title: CVE-2018-8400|2024-08-05T06:54:36.418Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the DirectX Graphics Kernel (DXGKRNL) driver improperly handles objects in memory, aka "DirectX Graphics Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-8401, CVE-2018-8405, CVE-2018-8406.

item.title: CVE-2018-8554|2024-08-05T07:02:24.988Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when DirectX improperly handles objects in memory, aka "DirectX Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10, Windows Server 2019. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-8485, CVE-2018-8561.

item.title: CVE-2018-8637|2024-08-05T07:02:25.868Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in Windows kernel that could allow an attacker to retrieve information that could lead to a Kernel Address Space Layout Randomization (KASLR) bypass, aka "Win32k Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10, Windows Server 2019.

item.title: CVE-2018-8399|2024-08-05T06:54:36.328Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows when the Win32k component fails to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-8404.

item.title: CVE-2018-8175|2024-08-05T06:46:13.386Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An denial of service vulnerability exists when Windows NT WEBDAV Minirdr attempts to query a WEBDAV directory, aka "WEBDAV Denial of Service Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10.

item.title: CVE-2018-8506|2024-08-05T06:54:36.906Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: An Information Disclosure vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Windows Codecs Library handles objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Windows Codecs Library Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10, Windows Server 2019.

item.title: CVE-2018-8211|2024-08-05T06:46:13.843Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20servers
item.description: A security feature bypass vulnerability exists in Device Guard that could allow an attacker to inject malicious code into a Windows PowerShell session, aka "Device Guard Code Integrity Policy Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability." This affects Windows 10 Servers, Windows 10. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-8201, CVE-2018-8212, CVE-2018-8215, CVE-2018-8216, CVE-2018-8217, CVE-2018-8221.
